intro: Vismia gracilis, commonly known as the slender vismia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its slender, often branching stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually alternate and can be either simple or lobed, depending on the species. Vismia gracilis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream sides.
